definition: to promulgate/to send out/to issue/to grant or confer
to/for/for the benefit of/to give/to allow/to do sth (for sb)/(grammatical equivalent of 被)/(grammatical equivalent of 把)/(sentence intensifier)

sentences.english: The Nobel has never been given out for applied sciences before.
sentences.chinese: 諾貝爾獎以前從未頒給過應用科學領域。

sentences.english: The first prize was awarded to the best competitor of the annual sports meeting .
sentences.chinese: 頭獎頒給了這一年一度的運動會上最優秀的運動員。

sentences.english: The highest scholarship went to a postgraduate majoring in physics.
sentences.chinese: 最高額的獎學金頒給了一位物理研究生。

sentences.english: His citation says he showed outstanding and exemplary courage.
sentences.chinese: 頒給他的嘉獎令稱他表現出非凡的勇氣，堪爲表率。

sentences.english: Last year, the award went to young director Li Yu.
sentences.chinese: 去年，這個電影節的獎項頒給了年輕的女導演李玉。

sentences.english: The prize for the best actor went to them.
sentences.chinese: 最佳表演獎頒給給了他們倆。

sentences.english: Our teacher presented the award to that straight-A student.
sentences.chinese: 老師把獎頒給了那個總考A的學生。

sentences.english: He present a silver cup to the winner.
sentences.chinese: 他把銀盃頒給了獲勝者。

sentences.english: I want to thank Dr. Steinberg for this  honorary degree.
sentences.chinese: 我要感謝斯坦博格博士頒給我這個名譽學位。

sentences.english: This award goes to the best multihull sailing yacht (catamaran, trimaran, etc) launched in the past year by any brand worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 這個獎項是頒給過去一年由亞洲船廠生產的最佳船艇。

sentences.english: Last year, the academy gave the prize to Turkey's Orhan Pamuk.
sentences.chinese: 去年，皇家科學院將此獎項頒給土耳其的奧汗。

sentences.english: Most importantly, Blueberry Garden is definitely worthy of the prize bestowed upon it.
sentences.chinese: 更重要的是，她對得起頒給她的大獎。

sentences.english: Luodian, a suburb of Shanghai, had considered offering the boxier honorary citizenship.
sentences.chinese: 羅店位於上海市郊，曾考慮要頒給泰森榮譽鎮民。

sentences.english: The best teachers award goes to you.
sentences.chinese: 因爲您的身教言教，頒給您最佳教師獎。
